page.title: 03Otmoor
page.content: Although only part of Otmoor is covered in the area of the 12 map squares it will be treated as a whole.Within living memory it was still a fen,but much of it has now been drained by the farmers and sown with cereals.There is still a wild area in the danger area of the Rifle Range and parts of it are designated as sites of special scientific interest.It is for instance the habitat of one of the few remaining colonies of the Marsh Fritillary butterfly.It still supports a good wildlife population and a bird species count made recently compares favourably with one made 50 years ago.In 1830 there were riots over the enclosures.Yeomanry sent to quell the riots marched their prisoners through St Giles's Fair where they were promptly freed by the populace!
